YOU COULD HAVE PREVENTED THIS
File (hide): 1455325340342.jpg (59.85 KB, 1024x839, 1024:839, would you really want to t….jpg)
ID: 056cb9 (33) No.4959610>>4959656 >>4960146 >>4960333 >>4960367 >>4960445 >>4960515 >>4960826 >>4961243 >>4963199 >>4963589 >>4970568 >>4981003 >>4981461 >>4985117 [Watch Thread]
Do you want the greatest red pill of all time?
The one to solve all of your deepest questions and desires?
You're here on /pol/ so I assume that you do.
Here it is.
At this point in time and space, you literally couldn't handle the true redpill.
The true reasons for why we do anything and why everything seems to occur without logic or reason.
This red pill goes back, way back, circa 1716.
All the richest and most powerful families in the world gathered in a chamber, once used for silly and pointless rituals by a unknown group of dead cultists.
They decided that the occult was bullshit, magic was just science and perception being altered and oh shit, all of these people we rule over are fucking retards.
Well, let's make them smarter. But not too smart.
We're also going to assign different families to different parts of the world to make our plan work.
And for thousands of years, this worked.
But eventually, for some ungodly reason, the Kennedy family's patriarch (gutenbergs originally) , grew a conscience. He couldn't stand by knowing that most of humanity would be made smart enough to be useful, but not smart enough to be self aware.
So in secret, he and others with similar mindsets set up their own meta-conspiracy to counteract it.
Didn't work.
For thousands of years, they were unable to break the programming on humanity.
Until they discovered the power of shitty Internet memes.
-cont

The greatest lie ever spread is that time is linear.
It's not.
It's like a massive quantum river, millions of light years across.
It also exists in every dimension, even ones that don't have space.
We have repeated this path over 10,000 times.
Our universe could be considered to be over 11 trillion millennia old.
So theoretically you could have two points in the universe appear very similar to each other. This is our universe right now.
Somehow, the ones on top figured out to stick us in the wrong timeline. They did this to achieve immortality at the cost of our suffering.
It ends this year. The mere fact that I'm typing this mean we have successfully broken the bonds between the wrong reality and this one.
And when the sentient species who live here realize what happened, they're going to be pissed

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4960689>>4960802 >>4988540
>>4959769
Nobody worth their salt really "believes" that "time is linear", that would be like saying "direction is linear" because you were falling out of a plane. Time is obviously the measurement of motion through a 4th dimension, as is well known. Just because we find ourselves propelled in a certain direction doesn't mean that the directions themselves are set any more than saying nothing in the universe can go up just because you happen to be falling down.
The way I like to explain this is thus: Imagine that you can take a snapshot of the quantum state of nature, aka you have a picture of each particle as it is in a certain moment. Then one quantum moment later, you take another snapshot, then another, etc. Then you take all those pictures and stack them up like a stack of papers. Then you shuffle through those papers like a flipbook, and see motion. Thus, time. By compressing 3-d to 2-d, and stacking the 2-d into a 3-d pile, we can visualize 4-d time. Compression is the standard way to visualize extra dimensionality.
On a more personal note, I know that a person can switch timelines on purpose, because I've done it several times when death was on the line. A couple of times I saved my own life, and once I accidentally shot a guy in the chest with a shotgun and wasn't very excited to stay in that reality, so I switched then. Actually, that might have been the jump that brought me to this iteration, when you jump a lot it gets hard to tell. That was in 1998, I was still pretty young at the time, but I noticed pretty drastic changes.

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4960765>>4960802 >>4960806 >>4960892 >>4961582 >>4962645
>>4960426
>>4960677
>salvia
>sucks
Bro, you need to rethink your strategy. Salvia is perhaps my favorite hallucinogen, but it's very touchy, very difficult to use properly. But used properly, it's a key to extra dimensionality. It's just hard for most people to deal with because it's so strange and uncomfortable. However, there are certain effects it has that are universal. It's basically like DMT, except DMT is comfortable and salvia is not. What most people neglect is studying their proper dosages. The best bet is to get a bag of the leaf, and sprinkle some extract on top of that. Most people just take a couple fat rips of 30x, feel uncomfortable, completely black out, and never try again. That's fucking pleb-tier. Salvia is for serious magicians, not for casuals. It's far more potent than LSD, actually it's more potent than any other compound by dose weight. People don't give it respect and end up on their asses, that's what happens.

That's why fasting is useful, it's a natural way to hyper-stimulate your dopamine receptors to offset those effects.

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4961002>>4961162 >>4981678
File (hide): 1455331569520.jpg (230.75 KB, 720x960, 3:4, magician1.jpg)
>>4960802
This seems like a fair place to share my ultimate psylocibin trip. I took a heroic dose of the best goldcaps I've ever seen, and then I meditated (as I usually do). And as I was doing that, I looked at the wall and thought to myself "You did it. You ascended." Which was odd because I didn't notice anything different. In fact I didn't feel like I was tripping that hard. But whatever, I thought.
So I kept meditating, and I closed my eyes. Eventually I left my body consciousness and was in a space of pure darkness, the velvet-black of the void. I was sitting on a raised dais on a throne, and below me were maybe a hundred orbs bouncing excitedly. I knew I had to pick a spirit to control my body while I left it, but these spirits were like excited children. Then one man in the back, dressed in black, slowly raised his hand, calmly. I chose him and gave him the rules he had to follow while driving my body, and let myself rise.
When I got to where I was going, I was like an infant, I had no means of locomotion. I was just floating on my back in something like air-water, and the colors swirled around me. It was a new color that I hadn't seen before, kind of like a pink-orange, but sparkly, and instead of the shadows being black they were violet. I floated there for some indeterminate amount of time until I came back.
It turned out fine, except the spirit I chose to drive my body was a "demon" that historically followed my friend around, it might have been the guy who killed himself in my friends old house because that house was haunted and lots of people experienced it. I thought he did fine with my body but apparently once he had control of it he went and fucked with my friend, insulting him etc. but following my rules to only tell the truth and to not harm my body or anyone else's, or any property. All in all I felt fine about it, if my friend was a bitch that's not my fault.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4961023>>4961080 >>4961162 >>4963563 >>4978040
>>4960807
Okay, here's my NEET guide to meditation:
When you wake up, don't move around right away, try to remember your dreams in detail. Within the first hour or two of being awake you can pretty much go about your day except I wouldn't eat breakfast until you've started meditating. Going for a walk, especially if it's early and still dark (like 4-5 AM) is a good idea, showering is okay but is probably better to do after your first meditation. Don't have anything caffeinated until right before you start, caffeine is a useful tool for meditation if used just right.
Find a comfy chair, one that will support having proper posture but will be comfy enough that you'll be able to forget about your body. Don't worry about going full lotus or anything silly like that, just be comfy but be sitting up. Now you need a good book - not just a good book but something full to the brim with wisdom, so that you can spend twenty minutes contemplating a few pages and ideas. Nietzsche's Thus Spake Zarathustra served me quite well a lot of the time but you can use anything as long as it fits a certain criteria of stimulating your mind and giving your discursive, rational self something to chew on.
Now you are comfy, with a nice caffeinated drink (and if you toke weed, now would be the time to have a hit or two - not too much) and a book, so the next step is to engage in CONTEMPLATION, which is a meditation upon thought and reason. Think deeply about what you are reading from every point of view, then think about why you think those thoughts. Examine your thoughts more deeply.
As you begin to examine your own thoughts you should now put your book down and stop sipping your drink (I hope you were't gulping it down, only sips here and there), close your eyes, breathe deeply using your diaphragm, and continue to examine your thoughts.
They will grow more spare as seem further away the deeper your breathe and the slower your heart moves. Eventually you will find a crack between the thoughts and slip in between it, but by then you will becoming quite drowsy. If you're not careful, you'll end up just napping (this will happen a lot in the beginning), and this is where the caffeine comes in handy.
From there you'll transition into a lucid dream, and from there higher levels of awareness. Those are entirely other subjects though.
Generally you'll then wake up, go about your business for a while, then repeat. Because you meditate so much, you will have a lot of energy and won't need to sleep so much.
Going for long walks is incredibly helpful for the meditative process and the silencing of the discursive mind. Hope that helps a bit.

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4961063>>4961072
File (hide): 1455331930197.jpg (190.53 KB, 906x465, 302:155, conciouspark.jpg)
>>4960892
> didn't even realize you could experience ego death from smoking it, let alone feeling as though I'd be unable to return to physical reality.
Yep, that's what happens. You pop out of your body and suddenly everything in your environment is conscious–the wall, the carpet, the crass, the music, everything. You realize you're just embedded in a conscious thing. You can't talk to people to explain this, but if you have strong thoughts the environment will respond to those thoughts. And often times you'll "see" other landscapes. Well, you don't see them, you have a visual memory of them. In the end when you're trying to get back to your body, you see an entire line of yourself, and you can't figure out which body you're supposed to get back into. Luckily, there is a build-in mechanism which brings you back to the right place.
One of the fun things about salvia is you don't build a tolerance. I've done a dozen trips in a night, and every time it was different, and every time it was scary before I blasted off again. But it's always worth the ride, to me. It's been years since I've tripped off anything, but salvia remains as my favorite substance by a wide margin.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4961148
>>4961080
Don't use the phone, or be around electronics or artificial light. They fuck with your levels of melatonin and other tryptamines that will have a negative effect on your meditation. You don't need to read Nietzsche, you could just as well pick up the bible or anything else lying around. It's not so much if you even agree with the book (it's almost better if you don't), but that it speaks to a certain level of the mind, someone truly thinking about deep subjects and not just obfuscating to signal intelligence.
>why only a couple of tokes
One of the great benefits of meditation is the ability to amplify or suppress any feeling or perception you experience. However, on a pharmalogical level, cannabis increases melatonin levels by 4000% 2 hours after smoking. Closing your eyes and breathing slowly will also amplify the drowsiness which is essential to breaking through. By all means, you know your own dose, but meditation will make that one hit far more powerful and useful.
>Good since I barely sleep anyway. usually 3 hours
That might come in handy.

>>4961183
Sure, I agree but the fact that there is a common experience is actually a sign that it's not just random brain firing. When you eat you feel full, when it's bright your pupils contract, when you fuck you feel dopamine rush, etc. Just because it's brain chemistry doesn't make it any less "real".
People tend to conveniently forget that they have no actual access to "reality", that everything they experience is filtered through the brain as physical effects and then again through the consciousness as only a few out of thousands of inputs are selected, based on previous experience. It just is what it is, in this sea of experience we're surrounded by, we notice almost nothing.

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4961439>>4961462 >>4961482 >>4961846
File (hide): 1455334216851.jpg (675.32 KB, 816x544, 3:2, 1421212548862.jpg)
>>4961322
I tripped salvia with my roommate back in college many times, and a lot of times it makes you laugh uncontrollably. We finally realized that the laughter is a defense mechanism that prevents you from telling other people a secret, the knowing of which would dissolve the world. We tried and tried to vocalize it to each other, until one day he was able to say it to me. He said, "This, and that…it's all the same thing." As in, when you're on salvia you realize that you and I are not separate entities, we're parts of one being. And by virtue of us being so close at the time, we're basically the EXACT same entity. And the same goes for your environment, it's all the same entity. I imagine that's why feng shui works, when it works at all. Because your environment literally IS you, so arranging your environment is arranging yourself. I'm not 'supposed' to say it, but when do I do what I'm 'supposed to do'? I found a rendition of this experience on salvia-trip:
>I saw the underlying mechanism that drives this reality with my own eye. I felt like I learned that none of us are really every in control, and we are puppets of some sort in this true reality. In this world, I felt like force instruct me not to reveal some great secret, otherwise I couldn't return to the world I came from and everyone I knew would be gone. I don't even know what the secret was. It felt like if I even considered the possibility of revealing this secret, that I would never leave this bizarre world again. It was like this was some mistake I kept repeating. These voices in unison, no louder than my own thoughts, were telling me that I could not share this secret. They said not even to your mom, your dad, your brother etc. It was the most terrifying experience of my life. I remember seeing/feeling myself fold into different realities, perhaps even experiencing the true nature of reality behind our own limited one. I learned some kind of secret, or saw something that I wasn't supposed to see, or perhaps wasn't ready for yet. I couldn't leave Salvia World with that knowledge I learned. I had to unlearn it so there was no chance of the knowledge entering this world from the Salvia World.

If you want to try it, here's a tip that took me a while to figure out. Doing it in a nice open field on a sunny day helps it be a pleasant experience. The sun makes a lot of sense, and you can spin and stumble without worrying about breaking anything. Plus nature has a lot of detail to look at.

>>4961557
don't turn to /pol/ for psychedelic advice.
first rule is have a trip sitter. you can only abandon this rule once you've been the trip sitter for so many people you can trip sit yourself. basically they're someone that's experienced that is there to take care of you. not some random person that doesn't know what the drug does, and not some irresponsible jackass that will paint dicks on your face or make you walk in traffic.
set & setting are always important. although some drugs will turn any setting into something entirely alien.

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4961653>>4961688 >>4961715
>>4961557
>What if I'm in the middle of tripping and I have absolutely no clue where I am?
You won't. You'll feel pretty sure that you're somewhere else, and you'll be talking to intelligences that tell you things that make no sense of your past experiences. A lot of times I feel like I'm in an alcove set off to the side of a large gymnasium full of interesting activities, and if I could just get around the corner I'd see an amazing new world. But I can't get around the corner. Bring some friends too though, having a sitter is usually a good idea until you know exactly what you're in for.
>>4961582

ID: 385049 (97) No.4961784>>4961932
>>4961715
I've had some freakouts on LSD but it was mostly because I was out in public when I shouldn't have been, and on other drugs to boot. Nothing wrong with going for a walk, but at some point you definitely want to get somewhere safe and start to just appreciate every little thing in glorious detail. All the songs you love, the books, the colors, how comfy your bed is. It can honestly be better than heroin, on a pure pleasure basis, but it's more of a deep seated joy. Everything subtle is suddenly vibrant, and a whole new world of meaning is present, whether in art, conversation, thought, perception, whatever.
Just don't get stuck in a negative feedback loop, and if you do then its good to know meditative thought-control techniques.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4962019
>>4961950
serious answer that has nothing to do with DARE based lies:
cannabis, as I said in an other post, releases melatonin levels by 4000% more than normal. This heavy release of melatonin is probably responsible for a lot of its health effects, however if you smoke heavily and especially during the day you throw your hormone system slightly out of whack. At noon your brain is supposed to be higher on serotonin and lower on melatonin, but if you smoke weed you're upsetting that balance and also making it harder for your brain to produce the amount of melatonin actually necessary to have a normal circadian rhythm. Smoking only at night will help this problem, as well as taking breaks from weed or eating foods heavy in tryptophan (although you want to get ALL your amino acids, of course). I've never been a fan of melatonin supplements but some people think they work.
The sensation of feeling burnt-out primarily comes from this melatonin imbalance.

ID: 644601 (10) No.4962115>>4962128 >>4962961
File (hide): 1455338216345.jpg (734.25 KB, 2048x1536, 4:3, 1344835542998.jpg)
>>4961950
Addiction to any drug is bad, obviously. I used to smoke pot everyday, then I became allergic to it (cannabinoid hyperemesis syndrome, still very rare) and almost died (sounds ridiculous but my kidneys almost shut down, my immune system became compromised, I lost 20 pounds of my weight, and I was intense pain + uncontrollably vomiting all day long). You're probably just wasting a ton of money if you use it routinely, it becomes a coping mechanism for some deeper problem. Any vice is simply a coping mechanism. I think weed has some function for meditation, and other ritual magick, but otherwise, abusing it like it's some daily elixir is just immature.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4962125>>4962278
So 2007 is a pretty big year for OP, and it was a pretty big year for me, spiritually & metaphysically. On may 5, 2007 I laid down to die and woke up entirely awake, instantly I knew my pineal gland was fully open and I noticed I could stop my thoughts and see prana. My entire life before that was a lie and a dream and I've spent the almost 10 years since then figuring out what is really going on. Not only that but I confirmed one of the teachings of that trickster-fraud Castaneda - that Fear is the first enemy of a man of knowledge. For a year before then I had put all my energy into spiritually evolving and overcame a lot of fears on a very personal level.
When I woke the day, I no longer felt fear, on a physical level. Physiologically I have been fundamentally different ever since then, and this is a real change that never goes away. Of course I still have an adrenal system, but it no longer grips my entire consciousness and makes me its slave. If something pops out at me I'll probably jump, but there will be no psychological terror.
Everything is crystal clear.
Of course, Clarity is the second enemy of a man of knowledge.

>>4962195
no no no, forget jogging or swimming or yoga, none of that will help.
You HAVE to open up your first chakra completely or all of your energy will go completely to waste. Your first chakra is truly your feet, and you have to walk until it hurts and then walk some more. Swimming will do absolutely nothing for this, considering you need a strong earth element. Walking barefoot uphill is probably the best, but anything where you can keep a steady pace for hours is good. Start off with an hour or two, workup to three or four, and then take a weekend off to walk a circuit of 20+ miles. 20 should definitely do it, maybe 15.
rubbing rocks on your feet, sleeping on the ground, and spending a lot of time outside will help.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4962376>>4962438 >>4962566 >>4970984 >>4990833
>>4962326
13 is an extremely important number spiritually, but for none of the reasons you'll encounter if you google it.
The truth is, and Mother Salvia graced me with this knowledge, is that there are 12 gods that correspond to the zodiac and to systems of the body and to many other things. But these 12 gods revolve around a singular God - the 13th realm ( non-gnostic mystery schools generally only accept up to 7-8 levels of reality but thats a pleb tier understanding) - which itself is actually only a portal to the self generated God and to even more unfathomable mysteries.
"Death Knight" because 13 is an "unlucky" number - in one perspective. Instead the 13 is outside of the scope of luck or astrology or anything. It's "death" but in a metaphysical sense, not the death that relates to the seasons of terrestrial life. Rather the death which is the void from where the lower 12 gods emanated from. This God is your highest self, and a portal to memories long forgotten. The consciousness that interprets your normal reality is best seen as the Demiurge, in gnostic thought. Interpreting a world and "creating", but not actually creating.

No, the king isn't Trump.
I've seen a timeline with him as president. And it is every bit of awesome that you think it would be.
Sadly, he would be killed two years into his term and his VP would turn absolute Christian Fundamentalist, bringing about a crusade and shit while most of the people starved.
No, the King is the king of all kings. His blood flows through all true kings and queens.
But, as kings and queens got deposed, their bloodline got all twisted, resulting in thousands of people with the blood of kings in their veins.
When he awakens from under the mountain, he will command this army and it will do battle with the forces of evil, in the middle east near the river Euphrates. We will witness this battle and we will triumph because our conviction is stronger and our faith is higher than any other being in existence.
as to how deep it goes, it goes back to Cain and Abel.
Abel reincarnated, got pissed about being murdered and decided to bring revenge on Cain, who had totally forgotten about it. Seeing how it was literally over 1,000 years prior.
It then evolved into the biggest dick waving in all of known history.
They finally settled their differences, only to find out that in the time that it took to forgive each other, time had passed them by. And they were forced to reintegrate into human society as demi gods. They used their power and influence to bring about world peace several times, before realizing that they needed extra help if they were going to stop the ones who put us here in the first place.
The very same ones that continue to provoke and stir up conflict around the globe.
They aren't black, white, brown or yellow.
They simply are. They control every facet of society through manipulation of past events.
they only figured out since New Year's that they couldn't alter past events anymore. Because this reality started December 31, 2006.
for some reason, someone had completely deleted the Universe's memory of the years 2007 to 2016. We had to relive them in order to break the hold that they had on us.
And starting next year, we will have returned to the timeline where the majority of people are from, the so called stein Universe.
Why and how people got chosen from different Universes is still unknown to me.
My theory is that by forcing a bunch of conflicting memories with each other, they would be able to imprint a base memory to start from.
I don't fucking know. Go talk to a scientist and ask him what he thinks of particle string theory if you want to know how one dimension/Universe could effect a similar one.

With the brownies? those were notoriously high-dosage (dosed half the town for free just because). 12-24 grams of nutmeg is good for a midtier, pleasant high. 24-36 is where things get really dreamy and hallucinogenic, and 48+ grams (like four regular sized nutmeg) is where you'll spend the next 36+ hours with bloodshot eyes higher than hell.
as far as hangovers go, I could write an entire book on the health benefits of cold showers and its modulating effect on consciousness.

ID: 7e5b66 (14) No.4962507>>4962516 >>4962533 >>4962566
File (hide): 1455340869433-0.gif (1.18 MB, 1072x9520, 67:595, dmt extraction huge.gif)
File (hide): 1455340869433-1.png (1.81 MB, 1311x3524, 1311:3524, dmt extraction.png)
File (hide): 1455340869433-2.jpg (1.07 MB, 1500x1500, 1:1, dmt machine 2.jpg)
File (hide): 1455340869434-3.jpg (948.79 KB, 800x5996, 200:1499, dmt sbt tek.jpg)
File (hide): 1455340869434-4.jpg (605.96 KB, 2554x1654, 1277:827, dmt the machine.jpg)
>>4962495
"dmt simple.txt"
Simple DMT Extraction Technique
DISCLAIMER: I do not encourage you to break the law or to do anything your mother would not approve of and this guide is purely for informational purposes only. Do not listen to anything I say ever and please keep in mind the name of this tumblr. You have been warned. I am not responsible for your actions.
Things needed:
900ml jar
200ml jar
100g Mimosa hostilis root bark
150ml Naptha
100g Lye (sodium hydroxide)
600ml Water
Turkey baster
freezer
scalpel
safety goggles
safety gloves
How it’s done:
Step 1 - SAFETY
Safety goggles and safety gloves should be worn while handling lye.
Long sleeve tops and trousers should also be worn for extra protection.
Lye reacts with water and becomes extremely hot, if any of the solution comes in to contact with skin or eyes, seek medical advice.
Step 2
The water should be boiled and left to cool and then the lye should be added until the solution becomes clear.
(Always add the lye to the water slowly bit by bit and not the other way round, as already mentioned the lye and water mixed together will become very hot and if the water is added to the lye it could become extremely hot and smash the jar and come into contact with skin)
Once the solution is clear the mimosa hostilis root bark is then added and submerged in the solution.
Then the lid needs to be screwed on to the jar and left at room temperature for 24 hours.
Step 3
After the 24 hours the naptha should then be added into the jar, the lid is then placed back on and the jar needs to be shaken.
The jar then needs to left alone for another 24 hours in somewhere heated, such as on top of a radiator.
Shake the jar every so often through out the 24 hours.
During this step the naptha slowly absorbs the dmt from the root bark.
Step 4
A turkey baster is then used to collect the naptha and put in to the 200ml jar.
The naptha should be completely clear, with a tint of yellow.
No brown liquid should be tolerated as this affects the dmt. If your naptha has a tint of browny orange, leave the naptha sit in the separate jar over night, the brown liquid should then separate and should be removed before moving on to the next step.
Step 5
The jar of naptha should be then placed in to the freezer for 24 hours.
The jar then needs to be taken out of the freezer and left for about half an hour so that the naptha becomes clear.
The naptha should be then be slowly poured back into the jar filled with the rootbark and left in the aquarium heater.
Step 6
There should only be crystals with a tint of yellow-white, left in the 200ml jar.
The jar needs to be left for 24 hours as it needs to dry out.
Placing the jar in front of a fan will speed things up.
Once the dmt is then dried, it can be then scraped out with a clean scalpel or knife.
Dosage, onset and smoking technique:
Threshold : 2 - 5 mg
Light : 10 - 20 mg
Moderate : 20 - 40 mg
Strong : 40 - 60 mg
Onset : 15 - 60 seconds
Duration : 5 - 20 minutes
Normal After Effects : 15 - 60 minutes
Although the internet is full of various smoking and vaporizing techniques that may or may not be more effective than others I’ve always found the simplest way to successfully smoke DMT is to put it into a normal water filtered bong with a small mixture of weed or other filler to absorb the DMT as it melts and light the bowl as usual. Take big pulls and hold them in for as long as you possibly can, if you are worried about the harshness of the smoke putting ice into the bong water helps drastically.
Useful Links: Here, Here and Here.
http://i.imgur.com/dJvwK.gif
http://www.erowid.org/chemicals/dmt/dmt.shtml
http://imgur.com/a/EqJpy

ID: 385049 (97) No.4962533
>>4962507
I would NOT recommend that method, it will work but its not as safe and produces a purely pharmaceutical N,N-DMT. There are many alkaloids present in say Mimosa Hostilis root back like yureamine which won't be present.
I recommend the FASA food-safe chemical method, using xylene and acetone. You can find it on the nexus, I'm not going to spoon feed anyone. Replace sodium hydroxide (lye) with calcium hydroxide.

there's one experience that sticks out incredibly vividly and I never could explain it nor did it ever happen again. It wasn't a dream, or a fever induced hallucination, or a seizure.

Speaking of Christ, are you lot all familiar with the Nag Hammadi library? It took me years of reading it to fully immerse myself in the language and understand some things, but holy hell. Compared to your normal bible, it's like a kick in the balls.
One of the biggest misunderstandings people have about Christ (and I will not sully the name of the great by using Jesus or Yeshua - nothing more than a vessel for an ancient power) is of his Suffering, his crucifixion, and what have you. It would be intuitive to think that he was in pain while it happened, but intuition would also have you believe that Christ could not perform miracles or anything. No, Christ was laughing the entire time, and the experience was the height of hedonistic pleasure that would make the Marquis De Sade blush. People do not understand how the world of energy works! Extreme pain, to the energy body, is no different than extreme pleasure. Both are incidentally quite deadly to the human organism.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4962964>>4963011
>>4962895
>Also shouldn't you be trying to find said object instead of shitposting on /pol/?
It's not an actual object like we know it, rather it's called the Object because it is the Prima Materia, it is the Platonic form of all Matter. It's not like you're just going to walk around and one day find it (Well, I guess that could happen, but it would be a very Lovecraft-opening-a-book-and-seeing-the-back-of-your-skull kind of way). The primary tool for exploring and realizing the levels of the Object is consciousness, and by shitposting on /pol/ with a bunch of freaks it might just trigger something. Who knows? Trying to consciously achieve it to claim power for yourself does not work out very well, the various intelligence agencies of the world were trying to break through a certain level back in the 50s using LSD and mind control techniques but they only succeeded in becoming essentially demonic interlopers in between realms. With their technology and skills - at least what they used to have - they might be able to turn things around for themselves and stand a chance but right now they're woefully behind.
This Game is as exciting as what Trump has down to the Presidential race (and if you don't think Trump and this entire reality we're going into isn't leading up into exactly unlocking another major point then you're wrong) except on a much larger scale. ID: 644601 (10) No.4963091>>4963116
>>4963051
and if you're suggesting cannabinoid hyperemesis isn't real, then you clearly have no understanding of the pharmacology of cannabis and the various functions of the endocannabinoid system. To employ magical thinking, to suggest that the endocannabinoid system can never be disturbed, is just ludicrous. The pharmaceutical complex already played a deadly game thinking that way with the testing of endocannabinoid receptor-specific anti-obesity drugs that ended up causing suicide in those who took them. Why don't you go ahead and learn about andandamide, and CB1 and 2 receptors and their functions before suggesting that cannabis is just some substance you piss out at the end of the night, or whatever it is that you think happens when you smoke.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4963116>>4963184
>>4963091
while you do have a point, the wonderful part about cannabis and many other plants is that generally the ratio of chemicals in them have a specific purpose, at least in relation to the human body. For instance, THC is known to cause psychosis but CBD is anti-psychotic. both are present in weed, but the Rx industry prescribes Marinol, pure THC, as a substitute for cannabis. This isn't even getting into many of the other plant chemicals.
I'm not saying cannabinoid hypermesis isn't real, to be honest I don't think there's enough evidence to say anything either way. Anyone that's familiar with synthetic cannabinoids understands how much fucking up the endocannabinoid system can fuck your shit up, though.

>>4962893
>Yes, all of the stories within this thread are nothing but pure fantasy.
I didn't mean that, I meant that we all live in a world sculpted by our own beliefs, regardless of whether those beliefs are in line with 'reality'. None of us has first-hand access to 'reality', so we act on our beliefs as if they were reality. The closer our beliefs are to reality, the more functional our behaviors are in getting us what we're aiming for. That's why it bothers me when people act as if their own interpretations are objective fact. It's a dangerous outlook, to think that you know absolute truth, and if you DID know that truth the universe would be small and boring. I prefer a more creative approach, and I've seen some shit and some shit accessories because of it.
>familiar with the Nag Hammadi library
Definitely, the Gospel of Thomas is a fun read, probably my favorite. Not to mention, the idea of Christ, or Krist, Kristos, etc., these all predate the Christian Bible by thousands of years as they were terms used by Ancient Aryans to describe someone who becomes enlightened. Of course all the symbolism of the cross, the bull, the fish, etc., those are all metaphors for solar and stellar functions. Again, that's science shrouded in story to be passed down through the ages.

ID: 644601 (10) No.4963184>>4963250
>>4963116
Well, the modern cannabis industry does a lot to breed for specific traits, so you will find many strains to have 25%+ THC and barely any, if at all, CBD%. So that has a lot to do with the increased potency of marijuana, in different regards. Spice is known to cause psychosis and hyperemesis, as well, so I'm sure there's some adverse properties to THC at a high enough concentration, probably has to do with the inhibition of natural endocannabinoids like anandamide which control mood and appetite– with no receptors to bind to and provide the necessary feedback, the immune system may be the agent that kicks in and produces a sort of reverse THC-like receptor antagonist that contributes to the anti-social, hyperemetic behavior of those in a spice rage/trip or those who chronically smoke.
I have a feeling this is epigenetic though, so it's not as though there is a certain limit all humans have that can be bypassed triggering a fit, just a novel reaction that was genetically advantageous in some regard. Or maybe stress fuels the response, dunno, still a lot being researched in this field. There are some based pharamanons on 8ch, surprisingly, so I'm sure one of them would have their own take on the phenomenon if they knew the current research up to this point.

ID: 2777dd (22) No.4963313>>4963368
File (hide): 1455347365765.png (19.38 KB, 519x521, 519:521, 1431511613167.png)
>>4963226
I got one for ya. I left my body about a dozen times from the ages of maybe 2-6, always at my grandparents' house. I remember I was still sleeping in a crib, but too old for it really. I could climb out if I wanted. So they put a single mattress on the ground, so I couldn't roll off and hurt myself. That night I floated up out of my body, up to a 'little room' in orbit (I now realize that would be a UFO of some sort, but I had no basis for comparison). In the room was a man and a woman, and a tall 'wise teacher' (which I now recognize as a 'tall white', but again I had no comparison at the time).
We'd all gather around a table with a half-sphere on it, and put our hands on it and zoom away to other planets. The 'wise teacher' told me I couldn't stay on Earth because I had 'obligations' on 7-8 other planets. I asked him, if I fulfill my obligations right now could I stay? He said yes, but that was pretty much impossible. Anyway, I went to the planets, fulfilled my obligations against all odds, and returned.
When I got back to Earth orbit I'd go through a door in the 'small room', into a huge gymnasium full of ball-pit balls, and on the other side was a giant monster coming to kill me. So I'd dig and dig under the ball pit, and suddenly I'd pop out into space over Earth. I'd quickly fall to Earth, and slow down as I got to the house, float like a feather through the ceiling and into my body. Then I'd just be awake with full memory, but I'd go back to sleep. The only image I smuggled back from offworld was of a teal-green Earthlike planet, but even that memory is contraband.
It turns out that was the bed my great-grandmother died on, and I have the intuition that it was my great-grandparents with me and the tall white on the ship. But anyway, this wasn't some rape memory, that shit was real. It happened every time I ever slept on that mattress, and never again once they got rid of the mattress. Neither is it my only experience with that race of ayyy lmao

ID: 644601 (10) No.4963360>>4963466
>>4963250
There have been some threads where I've been astounded by some anons' fucking knowledge in the field, but I think a lot of them were probably doing experimental psychs like 2C-I and whatnot in high school and used that to encourage their studying pharmacology in university. Usually they come out in threads like this because the few of them that, well, at least used to be here were pretty /fringe/ as a result of all their trips and basement drug synthesizing. But overall, I agree that most /pol/acks are mostly illiterate when it comes to science, but unlike politics and history, reading a science textbook is pretty laborious. Actually, I'd say the same about Marxist texts, lol, but whatever.
As for your nausea, dunno m8, cannabinoid hyperemesis is very, very rare. I'd sooner think it was inadvertently swallowing minute amounts of smoke/vapor and irritating your esophagus, but in my experience, CHS is a morning sickness in its prodromal phase, so you just wake up slightly nauseous with no appetite until you shower and maybe take a hit or whatever for months and months. I think you can be in such a situation for close to half a year before ever becoming hyperemetic, which is a very specific phenomenon when it comes to cannabis and is pretty much instantly recognizable to anyone familiar with the condition (because hot water alleviates the pain, something to do with receptors in the gut being turned off at a high temperature (above 105 at the least) or upon contact with capsaicin).

ID: b9eb29 (4) No.4963362>>4963399

ID: 385049 (97) No.4963401>>4964060
So, on the general topic of "occult experiences", plenty of people have had dealings with the astral realm. However I'd like to know if anyone has any experience with the Causal realm, (I'm not sure where exactly on the tree of life it's analogous to, but it is), of Platonic Ideas (but not pure Form per se). It always appears to me as a giant screen or membrane in a 5x5 grid (I don't know if that's hardcoded or just me), each cell containing an Absolute or a Principle. Things like Love, Freedom, Wisdom, Money, Truth, and many other things which are probably interchangeable with other things. The collective pressure from the lower and higher realms causes "tectonic shifts" every now and then, so to speak, among the casual realm which leads to a slightly differing order of reality as we know it. This is I think, for the occult anons waging war in the other realms, the best area to stage a battle. Although I don't know if we're waging a battle or just caught up in a stream that we have no control over. Are we drinking from the fount of wisdom, or drowning?

>>4963368
>anon got raped by his grandparents
I realize this is ironic shitposting. An I also realize that sometimes the idea of 'abduction' can be metaphor for molestation, but do you really think that every ayy-tier experience is so easily reducible to 'pee pee in poo poo'? It seems to be a pretty small-minded explanation. Not to mention I was never 'abducted', I went places of my own intention as part of a collective. I always looked forward to those experiences, and I still remember them clearly and fondly.
Also I wanted to add, the digging down to escape the monster part at the end…I've realized that that was a re-tuning of my spiritual wavelength back down to one of fear, down from the higher state of awareness that I was in. The fear aspect of this planet is one of its defining features, and for that reason most people don't come here willingly. Sometimes I even second guess myself, but I trust my soul to have made the right decisions. I rarely understand, but I recognize my spiritual fingerprints all over the fiasco. Putting myself into hopeless situations is EXACTLY what I'd do to myself, because easy things bore me. And I'm functionally invincible.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4963551>>4963576
>>4963506
That's a good question anon. Instead of actually answering how I did it, I'll take that question as a general question. I converted to Christianity on a visceral level and had my first out of body experience from a dream. This did not mean I stopped questioning the Bible, but now I had a good reason to seriously sit down and read it through. The many blatant contradictions in Genesis made me look for answers where I found the Lost Texts of the Nag Hammadi Library, which was just one piece of an ever growing puzzle.
There is still quite a lot of wisdom in nihilism, and Ecclesiastes in the OT spoke to me deeper than anything else in the bible. However that's just one layer. Accepting the cosmic power of Christ doesn't mean you don't recognize other gods, either. There's a lot of wisdom in the Norse, Greek, and Indian mythology.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4963634>>4963645 >>4963651
>>4963576
I'm a Gnostic, and therefore a heretic. The Catholic church used to hang gnostics and slander them to no end, because the Catholic church perverted anything holy and unique of Christianity. There's a lot to be learned from the gnostic teachings of Christ. In many cases in the gnostic texts, Christ is seen laughing his ass off as his disciples wail and whine about the loss of their eternal souls. He has nothing but contempt (a contempt born out of love, but contempt nonetheless) for them and it's hilarious and you can't help but laugh along, too. Then you realize the true hilarity of the meta-statement, because all of us act like those hysterical disciples.
read some Samael Aun Weor, although with a grain of salt. He was 100% against degeneracy and is the best resource for a lot of real information regarding astrology or Kabbalah. He's also where I first found >>4963596
Mr. Evola. Him, Rene Guenon, and Ernst Junger were my first foray into proto-fascism several years ago before /pol/ was even a board on 4chan. Much respect and love to all of them. I was pleasantly surprised when years later I stumble upon the alt-right and found other people that actually read these authors.

most likely this is shit posting
it isn't really related
So to put it short.
When I was just 5 I told my mom that our house would be struck by lighting. Before she could finish telling me that wouldn't happen. Lighting hit our house and went right over our heads. Blew up our old tv.
Starting from when I was a kid. Maybe 10.
I noticed I diet have to study for any tests.
No matter the test I didn't even have to do the homework. I just "knew" the answer.
Then in high school.
I predicted the death and near death of two close friends.
I told one and not the other about a car crash they would be in.
Chris died because I wasn't sure of my ability of foresight
That still bothers me to this day
I later went to a pagen. She told me that I need to be careful. There is a vail between dimensions. "Foresight" pokes a small hole in the vail. Spooky shit happens when the holes are to big or to many in one area. I didn't believe her.
One night while walking back home from work I heard a soft crack.
The lights in the whole area flickered on and off weakly.
A figure.
A dark figure.
Covered in black fire.
Appeared where I had just walked from.
This black fire started spreading around the ground as he walked towards me.
He called my name.
I turned to run from him.
As I passed a building he appeared behind a parked car this time larger. Larger arms with larger fingers.
I made it to lamp post that was still on.
And stayed their till dawn.
Is this related?
No drugs were included for any of this
Inb4 just fucking crazy

ID: 832959 (8) No.4963692>>4963748
File (hide): 1455350427820.jpg (537.86 KB, 1900x1425, 4:3, 1330405783922[1].jpg)
Actually I would like to make another post. I read the op, but I've only briefly glanced at the actually thread; however as I said about this being a shitposting thread I'm just gonna regurgitate some philosophy for you guys. Having dealt with new-agers, I'm pretty sure I know what this thread is about.
I have absolutely nothing mind blowing to share with any you, it's probably already been mentioned in this thread and even if it hasn't you already know what I'm going to say.
If we are to define god as being everything and nothing, we are all part of god, therefore we are all god.
We are all everything and nothing. All possible timelines and realities exist (for instance, this could be a timeline where no other timelines and realities exist and everything I just said is bullshit.), some perhaps only in imagination, but even if just that, they still exist.
All of this bullshit being talked about in this thread, is just bullshit. It's only as real as you want it to be, "you" being god, so really taking into account the infinite timelines of infinite possibilities, you want everything and nothing to be real. I say want, but that's simply what is, everything and nothing simply "is." Time is an illusion because everything and nothing that are and could be already "is."
You can talk all you want about good conquering over evil, but every timeline already exists, and in some of them good loses, and there's absolutely nothing wrong with that. There are timelines where Christianity is real and hell is real, just like there are timelines where you reach nirvana and others where you don't. The you that you are right now could be in any one of those timelines. Op saying
>It ends this year. The mere fact that I'm typing this mean we have successfully broken the bonds between the wrong reality and this one.
doesn't mean shit, because there's a timeline where he makes this thread and none of the bullshit he thinks happened happened. And there's nothing wrong with that. Losing is part of a game. There's nothing "wrong" with anything, because wrong is just a part of everything. What doesn't exist, defines what does. Everything is perfect in whatever state it's in because all states of being (and not being, lest we forget) are part of god.
That's why I find it annoying when this anon >>4962741 says there are no adults, based on his interpretation I wouldn't say he's wrong, but we're all "the adult," we're all god, we're all "pretending."
Saying "especially not in the Age of Horus," tells me he's no more an adult than those he would consider children. To believe anything is "childish." That's why I don't believe anything, including the fact that I don't believe anything, because of course I believe some things, I'm only human after all.
Without people pretending to be people we couldn't have fun being people, and not having fun is part of the fun. I just wish you faggots would stop taking this shit so seriously; though obviously that's just an element of my human character.

ID: 385049 (97) No.4964199>>4964224
>>4964156
I feel like you people are giving hedonism a bad name. People smoking weed all day and eating hotdogs are not really hedonists, in the purest sense of the term. Maximizing your absolute pleasure can have you ending up in some fairly redpill mindsets (no one wants niggers in their mahogany library while they sip brandy), although for a lot of the wrong reasons. To a certain extent, there is a kind of hedonism that is a sense a sort of red pill, a turning on of the senses. You especially experience this on LSD where the most subtle of perceptions or pleasures become as amazing as the Sistine Chapel. Hedonism can be, I suppose, 40 oz of old english and fried chicken, but the romantic in me thinks of silk and cashmere and gold and jewels and fine wines and ancient literature and high bred women and incense and music and art. In a sense, the Dionysian embrace of life, but in this instance in a basically European one.
Smoking pot and jerking it to anime is a shame upon the glorious venture of hedonism.

ID: 060723 (3) No.4964486>>4964539 >>4966630
File (hide): 1455358052875.png (257.4 KB, 1440x780, 24:13, Hawk2.png)
Word to the wise folks, don't create create tulpae. Even as a joke. I once created one by accident. It's a really nasty psychological parasite that calls to mind the homunculus; ie: A creature that is for all effects and purposes a different version of you, but can only become you by getting rid of the origional.
It started like this. I went through a lot of psychological stress and decided to lock up all my nasty dark, predatory energy in a safe, and set a 'guard' A piece of myself, to act as both safekeeper and achivist. I used it as a soundboard to resolve issues and gain insight to problems.
However over a few years it was steadily gaining in strength. One night, during a journey on pure MDMA, I decided to pull a prank on a friend of mine by pretending to be it. Unfortunately, the fucking thing began to take on a life of it's own, and gave itself a name: Jackal. It began to assert itself more and more. It was a seperate program sharing the same drive space. Not seperated, not alternate personality, (we shared the same space and everything in it) Just he was a different perspective.
Personalty? Darkly Humorous, predatory smirk, Cynical, and enjoyed fucking with others by telling them fucked up truths while they did degenerate drugs.
Then after it got ugly, I used a heroic dose of MDMA, Lsd, and the guidence of a weirder freak than me to merge 'us', into 'I'
Have to say, there's weird shit in the subconscious mind
Pic is the closest thing to What he looked like in my minds eye.

ID: d587ef (6) No.4964508>>4964535
YouTube embed. Click thumbnail to play.
Guys watch this video, its about explaining the 10 dimensions in a manner normies can more easily understand it. Watch the first 26 minutes of it, which is a summery of all the different dimensions starting from a point(1D) and then logicing your way to 2D, then 3D, then 4D, etc.
While watching it I was making some connections between fringe shit I read while causally lurking these sorts of threads over the years. My interpretation of this is that our physical bodies are stuck in 3D reality, and partially in 4D(but only instantaneously since the 4th dimension is all that has been, and that will be in a certain time line). 5D is every possible branch of different time lines that could have happened in our unique universe, the realm of quantum physics.
Now I believe that 5D is where the memetic magic happens. Through our collective will, we guide our selves down the path of the infinite amount of possible outcomes to the desired destination with or without consciously being aware of it (the most notable example is the /bane/ crash shit that happened a while back).
But we cannot physically go any further than this, the higher dimensions above 5D that wont effect our 3D world anymore, we reach a saturation there.
6D and above are the realms of the non-physical. 6D is where every possible KIND of universe exists. That means every possible unique universe containing any possible universal laws are existing here. Meaning in one universe gravity could make stuff fall up instead of down, and gravity repels mass instead of attracting it. When we dream our spirit can enter this 6D realm, and travel between different types of universes where shit doesn't any damn sense at all to us because the laws of the universe are completely alien to us.
I'm sure you guys get the point so I'll stop here. I'll end this autistic rant by saying the final (10th) dimension is all things, nothing greater than it can exist, and you cannot possibly imagine it. Some call it "The All", some call it "God".

ID: 89c6ce No.4964868
File (hide): 1455362322865.jpg (52.37 KB, 940x627, 940:627, climb into my mouth.jpg)
I think OP is a drunk SA goon trying to be funny, but this is an interesting subject so fuck it.
Once after a hard bender I dreamt of a city where sky-scrapers were falling like dominos (toppling over sideways, not collapsing on themselves). It was like a disaster flick but even more unrealistic.
I felt pure elation, like I was seeing the end of the world. It was so exciting I forgot to be scared.
Suddenly, I felt someone grab my toe. I instantly awoke only to be yanked out of my bed, onto the floor of the hotel, and out the door. I could sense one entity watching me from a corner while another pulled me. I couldn't make out either of them.
Then I woke up properly and realized it was just a dream.
The only thing is that every time I remember that night I get a strange chill up my back. It's similar to how I felt watching those enormous buildings collapse, but creepier.
One more thing. Once while tripping on some weak acid I got a rush of information and felt like I was plugged into a thing bigger than me. I felt like more evolved people were watching me and cracking jokes as I fumbled with all the information I was given. It felt like being new to an imageboard and not getting the in-jokes and lingo. Has anyone else had this experience?
Plz help me understand you schizo meme wizards.

ID: b00f3a No.4965018>>4965144 >>4980431
File (hide): 1455364262036.png (30.03 KB, 699x518, 699:518, aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa….png)
In a time of great psychologic stress in my past, I was having a lot of sleep paralysis… Even once being awakened from my sleep by the touch of death's bony hand, after having fallen in a train track (in said dream).
Near that same time, I also met what I would consider my greatest demon, in a dream… I was walking along a street similar to a comercial street here in my city, only it looked centuries older, it was deep night, and I was alone with a girl (she was a mix/compostie of a another girl I knew plus a psycho/depressive chick I was dating at the time because I was a horny young retard, and had massive problems in my life due to that).
So as I accompanied that girl, as she sang, who was singing nicelly but with nihilist despair, I crossed a building, with a clear-glass front instead of concrote/brick or wood (you could see both floors and the stairs). It was two stories high and although I could see the interior, 60% of it was hidden in deep shadow.
As I crossed it, I saw this entity inside, partially hidden in the shadow… A tall, slender/skinny greenish "monster", with huge black eyes, and I think it had skinny sharp fingers (not sure), it kinda looked like a mix between the stereotypical green ayylmao and a gray ayylmao, only more… Savage, or primal.
As I crossed the building, if I recall correctly, the girl was singing in high notes, to which the creature reacted, and screeched… The girl kept singing, maybe in even higher tunes to sing over the screech but she quickly faded from the dream. Immediately after the creature screeched, it quickly hid a bit more in the shadow. Defiantly, I screamed back, as high as I could, into the shadows…
The creature then reacts, emerges a bit from the shadows and lets out such a powerful second screech that I feel completly overpowered, terrified and then I woke up.
Does this mean anything?

Also lucid dreaming, its fucking insane and simple. You basically just control yourself as you would in real life, just instead of letting your mind take you for a ride, you make decisions and choices. That didn't really teach anything so ill give an example. Say your friend is falling from a tree 10 feet up (in your dream of course). You have to make a choice weather or not you are going to try and catch him or not. Only the choice is made by thinking and not by acting. Like if you think you are catching him then you will be catching him but if you think he fell to the ground and got hurt than that's what happened. You don't see what happened until after you thought about the outcome.

ID: 3bbe71 No.4970797>>4970874 >>4971114 >>4973583
>>4969872
Hey man, no one's been able to explain some strange shit I've experienced. You seem like you're well read and experienced in the weird, maybe take a crack at it so I can get a better frame about it?
1. Often times when I have new thoughts I find that reality warps around those new thought to accommodate it. This seems to be true about my perceptions of people as well, if my perception of them changes, they change to the point where other people will bring up that that person is acting differently.
2. Salvia trips for me are always the same: I start in a street on the suburbs. All of the houses start screaming and the whole scene starts melting down until there is a tunnel made of images from the suburbs. Then I fall down the tunnel of screaming houses which branches off in various directions. Like a horrific Alex Grey painting. I'm completely out of my body and reality and pretty much just have to cope until I come out the other side.
side note: last time i tried it i asked for mercy and felt something acknowledge that I was as a child and I came down earlier/softer than usual. Freaked me out so I never did it again.
3. My fucking dreams. I'll dream of shit in story lines. For example, one was about the Monster in the black Tower whose face and body were covered in pieces of metal screwed to him. The tower was in his own private pocket dimension and he would drag people there to do his work on them. Then it transitioned into following the Woman in the Car who had formed an Interest in these disappearances. So she investigated them and talked to experts about them until she started to see the connections, that all of these people had been into the occult and were being stalked. Her practice with the occult materials of some of the victims gets her seen by the monster. When she starts to be stalked and shadowed by it she goes back to the experts who all turn her away, scared for their lives or frauds. Then she drives away, trying to escape it. Of course matters of distance are not a problem for it and she is caught. He then drags her through the Tower, puts her on his Forge (which is like an anvil mixed with an old metal mortician's slab). He straps her down and disfigures her by screwing, stapling and nailing pieces of tainted materials into her skin. After the screaming stops he puts down his tools, back away and she's stands up, another one like him. Then they both turn and stare out at something. It took me a minute to realize they were staring at me. They smiled, ichor and oil running in between their teeth and I got away/awake as fast as I could and felt. That one woke me up with chills and the feeling that I got away in the nic of time.
I have others similar to this. I'm rarely seen but when I am it always freaks me the fuck out.
It's embarrassing because I still don't really believe in the occult but I'm terrified of learning about it for some reason. Each time I try to read books about it I become filled with dread and my skin pricks up.
Am I just a guy with too much imagination?

ID: 385049 No.4974690>>4978132
>>4974514
Seems a pretty normal experience, your only fault is that you assumed that what was wrong was that you were on salvia. There's probably a lot of deep psychological issues you need to work on, seeing the various layers of yourself and how they interact but are somewhat independent probably freaked you out.
Your bit about yelling about control could have either been you utilizing your will or just freaking out enough that the adrenaline stabilized out parts of the trip
By the way, fun pharmalogical fact, Salvia is incredibly unique in its mechanism of action because it acts on the kappa opiate receptors. Yes, technically salvia is an opiate, but there are three basic opiate receptors, kappa, mu, and delta. Kappa deals with the actual sensation of your body, which is why salvia produces out of body experiences. It completely numbs you in a way that most other drugs couldn't begin to without killing you. The mu opiate receptor it the one responsible for euphoria, and the delta receptor is related to temperature regulation.

You are absolutely correct, it's not supposed to be a 1:1 description.
It's more like an encapsulated environment with natural rules that can be arbitrarily broken by external entities in a manner that does not disrupt said environment.
In this analogy, should the automated deamons (even the name is the same lmao can't be a coincidence) that sorta maintain and "run" the system operating as extensions of the will of the developer fail to pick up the trash so to speak, even if the great sysadmins of the universe were to manually shit something up he could rollback or undo it to a state in which he could apply a fix and restart the thread from a safe point.
The one thing that bugs me is that I don't understand how we could be anything other than "threads" running inside the VM - all you have to do to give a "thread" it's "free will" is build it in a way that the "administrator" can't access it in the same manner he can do with daemons, and I don't see much reason to support the idea that there's some sort of external entity that our consciousness will return to once "free" from the VM because of that.

ID: bf5303 No.4980138>>4980317
>>4974514
It's interesting that getting scolded by a voice seems to be a recurring theme here.
Storytime.
I tried shrooms twice. They always talk about set and setting and all that shit and having a sitter but I'm an explorer like Dora so I decided to throw the rulebook out of the window to brave into the unknown alone and ate two thirds of the recommended amount - they came dried in little packages of 10g or something, I don't remember.
The night had already been rough, I had been the godfather to an orthodox wedding and ate a lot of food but didn't got to bang the bridesmaid that wanted me to bang her so I was pissed off. But shit only really got bad once I felt my stomach telling me that I should have had an omeprazol half an hour before eating a mushroom that has been god knows where.
From there on, it was all downhill.
I'll spare you guys the details but I absolutely lost control of my emotions and couldn't feel anything but cold and fear, especially of getting myself locked for 4 to 8 hours into a bad trip. I couldn't feel my legs, and just felt… sick.
So I dragged myself to bed and covered myself in blankets and moaned to myself about how this was a bad idea and then the lightshow hit me and I got this really really really weird impression that there was a flaming eye or some other circular thing talking to me telling me how much of an ass I was making of myself and how I had to basically git gud.
I apologized in a very humbling way and the entity burned me in my stomach and I fell asleep.
Two weeks later I ate the last portion in a sunday afternoon while smoking a doobie and chatting with friends and listening to the crypt of the necrodancer soundtrack, and had a great feeling of joy and happiness, but didn't got any lights or voices or anything.
My perception of the world obviously changed after that event, but then again so does everything that I experience, but it's weird that ever since this happened I have felt more… attuned, I wanna say?
I also feel a little bad that I promised to respect the power of shrooms in the future but I honestly feel that next time I'm also gonna do it alone in my room with not much fetishization over the consumption of 'em. I've always learned stuff on my own and it would just feel weird to get me a guide now.

So that raises the ultimate question, greater than even your claims' legitimacy: Why would you of all people have a conscience about this shit, rather than doing whatever the fuck you want with no regard for consequences outside what affects you personally, and letting the chips fall where they may? This is all of course assuming you're not just another acid-addled nobody, babbling about shit that's close enough to semi-accepted fringe theories like the Berenstein/stain Universe Transfer to incite interest rather than being rebuked immediately, but which also makes no sense beyond that initial semi-sensible hook.

I've have pretty decent knowledge of my past lives but however vague knowledge of the future. It's pointless to get into to many specifics but I have been called and held by the heart strings.

And for 5 years I lived with these seemingly hodgepodge group of people always in my life at one time or another all interconnected.

I was introduced to him a kid I went to school with who just happened to be the principals son. I suspect I was targeted for this.
Well it took me a long time to make sense of every thing but Eric told he was sorry for what he had to do and they he had no choice one night he drove me to the desert and told me every thing. He told me to run. To leave town and and stay low.

>>4980370
Yeah, it was the Gifted and Talented courses I was in.
Fucking hell what is going on.
I remember trying to talk about time collapsing in black holes to the students around me but I got called the freak pretty much.
First grade teacher actually told my mom I was a retard, but I got tested by the school and it floored them.
They didn't believe it, so they had me take the Stanford-Binet test sponsored by MENSA.
I had 148 IQ in 1st grade, I don't really mind if some of you don't believe me because I can't provide immediate proof, the papers are with my mother right now.
So, I got placed in a Gifted and Talented Education program, and apparently there was something special about me where I got to stay in the class for significantly longer than the other kids in there, where while they had to go back to class I spent the whole day there. Something about me synergizing with language and mathematics at the same time that made me unique. I messed around with robotics and speculative shit there, too. I thought it was fun, but now that I think about it I was being closely monitored the whole time.
Not just that, I was promptly accepted into the Johns Hopkins GTY program for Mathematics, and I was the only student in that section to pass without failure.
It's only now that I'm noticing that the mathematics I learned in that class had more to do with Calculus, the trivium (Logic, Rhetoric, Grammar, which naturally corresponds to modern Linguistic theory), and computer programming. Hell, there were things that my IB Calculus teacher in HS didn't know that were practically second nature to me.
Also, had a NDE when I was seven. Strangled by a downie in the bathroom until I blacked out. Suddenly I was fine and he was strangling the kid in the stall next to mine. I'm pretty sure he would have died had I not intervened. I was near-catatonic for a year after that, and finally broke down about dealing with the concept of death.
I still had the bruises though. Not sure how that works.
How has so many people, with so many similarities come together in a single place, all being considered pretty exceptional individuals?
>tfw "How the Gifted Brain Learns" by Sousa is on my bookshelf right now

ID: 859c09 No.4980831>>4980844
File (hide): 1455441029430.jpg (64.59 KB, 500x748, 125:187, 1414560738950.jpg)
>>4980754
"Gifted and Talented Education"
From kikepedia:
>In the United States, each state department of education determines if the needs of gifted students will be addressed as a mandatory function of public education. If so, the state determines the definition of which students will be identified and receive services, but may or may not determine how they shall receive services. If a state does not consider gifted education mandatory, individual districts may, thus the definition of what gifted is varies from state or district.[36]
>In contrast with special education, gifted education is not regulated on a federal level, although recommendations by the US Department of Education are offered. As such, funding for services is not consistent from state to state, and although students may be identified, the extent to which they receive services can vary widely depending upon a state or district's budget.
I seriously haven't thought about it until anon jarred my memory by mentioning it itt.
I remember getting picked, and I remember my idiot mother acting smug as fuck about it, but I don't really remember how they differed from my normal classes in any significant way.
I actually remember hardly anything about them.
Shits getting creep in here tbh.

ID: c1d6d8 No.4980935
During my years traveling I sought to make my self and those I came into contact with better people, I took my life and what I knew to try and make sense of it all.
It was a calling I can only describe as pure to don a backpack and travel as the great men of history before me have done.
At 17 I had a very profound trip.
My experience with salvia is rather intense and it was mind blowing experience I ate a god amount of kabenzi and heres the kicker accidentally smoked a huge bowl of salvia, I was wholly unprepared for what I was about to experience.
It was several hits in that I decided I wasn't smoking weed. The universe kaleidoscoped and fractured into 2, 4, 8, …. And I was was shot towards another star at instantaneously only leaving earth and approaching the destination was speed ever palatable. What I saw was incredible, buildings, cars, "people" that had arms, legs, some were fat, some ugly, some pretty but other than the smallest details we were the same. Then another.
Then another, Some were far more advanced than us, others the same level, some a little bit behind, some were pacifists, some waged ceremonious wars on a schedule.
And I got it. Or so I said, to my concerned friend. The night was only getting started. This was back when I had friends and didn't lock my self in a memeaday cage, my phone started going off every one was texting me but I couldn't distinguish letters so every thing became "?" A=? b=? 1=? 2=?. I got on my bike and had just started riding. I had to jettison my phone because not being able to read really fucking scared me, shortly after matter started to destabilize, my bike tires were sinking into the ground, there were freight trains traveling off tracks. It was still really early in the morning around 2-3 o clock and I had barely made it a mile and a half when the trip took me 5 minutes. I stopped at the bus stop and looked for some one that would let me use their phone, I ran into three people and I couldn't communicate to them even though I knew what I was saying was correct.
I left out the bus station on my bike and was hit buy a red truck, it left the scene, I lost a shoe, cut my elbows, and hit my head pretty hard, so now add in a concussion.
I'm seriously fucking pissed at this point because I'm injured and moving even slower. I make it about another half mile to the train tracks in my neighborhood and I'm having a seriously fucked moment, I started thinking about the abuse and the police and what plan this all belonged to.
I sat by the tracks and considered jumping infront of the next train and I'm visited by an angle that says he's an arch angle of time. I am told this is a test to break me, to see if I can be broken. That the night is going to get much worse before it gets better but more it'll get better. I see every thing from the first second to the last.
Then I am placed back into my moment, I'm starting to really feel the affects and I'm approaching another level. I got on my bike and started trying to ride it, but it was busted up pretty good with waffled tires and I fell over and ended up landing on my already shredded palm.

ID: e52f83 No.4980942>>4980946 >>4980968
>>4980908
Yeah, you're thinking of electroencephalograms, EEGs. They monitor baseline brain activity.
Apparently those marked as "gifted" not only have their brain working in greater unison when dealing with familiar subjects, indicated by more prominent and organized Alpha waves, but have greater decoupling and utilization of the different portions of the brain at different times based on analysis of Beta activity.
It's also been recorded that gifted children appear more empathic and more clearly emotional than is normal for their age.
I used to consider the whole "indigo children" thing bullshit, but are we some kind of weird MK'd equivalent?
